scenario_text.value: Professor, I didn’t realize you were here.

Oh, is that you, Takuma? How’s everybody
holding up?
Uhh...

(Honestly, we’re not doing great...
But should I really say that?)

(The professor’s been through a lot,
yet he’s working hard so we can rest more.)

(Might not be a good idea to stress him out
with the honest truth.)

(Then again,
being dishonest might cause trouble later.)
(How should I respond to the professor?)
Not great.
Everyone’s on edge.
We’ll be fine.

Well, I wouldn’t say we’re great.
Everyone’s totally exhausted.

I figured as much.
But how are you?
Me?

After everything that happened I thought
you’d be as exhausted as the others.
I see what you mean...

But I feel fine.
I’m just worried about the others.

I won’t stop you if you’re okay,
but don’t push yourself too hard.

Everyone’s really agitated.
People are fighting.

The exhaustion, the stress, the fear...
No wonder everyone’s on edge.

But you’re okay?
Where’s your exhaustion and fear?

I feel some,
but not as bad as the others.

I see. You might be stronger of heart.
Or, you’re going through the same as them.

Don’t push yourself too hard.
Mental hurt is harder to see than physical.

I...think I’m okay.
Don’t worry.
I see. Everyone seems very tired.
Yeah, but...how’d you know?
Let’s say it comes with age.

There’s no need to lie to prevent me
from getting worried.

I’m an adult, and my age means I must
use my experience to protect you.

Trying to hold yourself back won’t help.
Please rely on me as you need to.

As I think you’ve noticed, the Kemonogami
change based on your inner state.
Yeah, that seems to be true.

That’s why I want everyone to be strong.
However, I realize that may be a tall order.
To say the least...

Nonetheless, as long as you remain true to
yourselves, you will overcome this ordeal.
That’s what I believe, at least.
I hope you’re right...

Still your connection with the Kemonogami is
mysterious. Each is like it’s own pairing...

No, that’s not right. More like, they’re each
resonating uniquely with their partner.
Huh. I hadn’t thought about it like that...

I don’t want to see another young person lose
their future. I don’t want that regret.

What happened to Shuuji was my fault. I’m
the adult. I should’ve done more.

What? Professor, you can’t blame yourself for
what—

No, I failed to notice Shuuji changing. That
alone was a grave mistake on my part.

I should’ve talked to him more. I might’ve
figured out what was bothering him inside.

Lopmon had never transformed in that manner
before, either.

Manner? In what manner? What are you talking
about, Professor?

The Kemonogami reflect our inner state and
change accordingly... I believe so, at least.

That’s why Lopmon reflected Shuuji’s
confusion and transformed into Wendigomon.

But even with my theory I was unable to do
anything to help poor Shuuji.

And at the end of the day, that is something
I must take responsibility for.
Professor...

On that note, I think I’m going to look
elsewhere to confirm some other things.
Okay. Be careful, Professor.

(The professor is exploring for us.
I should go check on everyone.)
